Speaker: debutante
Dialogue: I see the deuce, and one to chase them home.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Very nice, Barbie.  Now, I'd take Ken over there and go home.

Speaker: boyfriend
Dialogue: The lady wants to play.  Someone should teach you to be a better loser, loser.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: -- I'm offering you the benefit of my experience.

Speaker: debutante
Dialogue: Looks like you have a lot of experience in places like this.  It was nice of them to relax the dress code for you.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Typical New York woman, big attitude, small apartment, no tits.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I think she got to you, pappy.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You want a popsicle, go to Good Humor.  And don't call me 'pappy.'

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Still, you gotta wonder how she'd look in handcuffs.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: My name is Conklin.  Let's do this fast so I can go home.

Speaker: zachara
Dialogue: Under section 216 of the New York State Penal code, I serve notice that this premise and it's occupants...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Whoa -- where do you think you're going, hotdog.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: ... It's not like you were slow or anything... I think you did just fine.  I think you did great.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Wait up.  You know the guy who did the Weismuller through the window --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: He works for Frank Abolofia. Atlantic City.  Casinos.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: So why dive through the glass for a nickel and dime bust?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's not regulation.  And the only way you're gonna stop anybody with it is to show it to him, and while he's laughing, you can shove it down his throat.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I'll get rid of it when you get rid of the egg-beater.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Nick, let's go hunting.  Bag Cavello.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: ... You still got shaving cream on your ear.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: Yeah... I came to save you.  If you're hopeless, I'll pull the plug.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: It's getting too cold even for me, Nick.

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: All right, how's the new partner?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Give me a break, would you?

Speaker: connie
Dialogue: Imagine a small, greasy Boy Scout.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: ... I found the goombah... Cavello. He's --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: -- I should tear your head off.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Whoa, I knew you were going to say that.  I absolutely anticipated that, Nick.  But I said to myself, Charlie, Charlie, we can move up on this, so go find Nicklaus... He'll be pissed for a moment, but then it'll dawn on him --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: -- Hey, I got a better chance of being hit by a bus then moving up.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: ... Look... they told me at the Greek's you were here.  I'm sorry, I never imagined...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Eating Scungilli, just like the last time you asked.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Who do you think the Jap is?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Maybe Cavello's buying a Subaru. How would I know?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I don't blame you for being sore. It'll pass when we bag him.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Whatdaya think?  'Bostonians'. Eighty-five bucks.  Hey, I read it in a magazine.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Charlie, don't do anything.  Promise me?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Charlie, take your gum, stick it under your ass and keep it warm.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Call 911.  Tell them an officer needs assistance.  Say ten thirteen.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: How big a package we talking about?

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: The old man was a Japanese paper manufacturer.  Hotel room and rental car were full of it.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: Art and stationary paper.  Cavello had five hundred thousand in his attache case.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: One guy do all the damage?

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: Thought you knew your way around dark alleys, detective.

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: ... The old man's suit was Japanese. The hitter's was Saville row.  No I.D.  We're doing a peel now.

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: There's something you got to see.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I got a tattoo.  Birdie on the ball. We all got them when we finished basic at Camp Lejune.

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: I thought you guys were trained observers?

Speaker: techie
Dialogue: Eight fingers.  Hey, it was a trick question.

Speaker: abolofia
Dialogue: He was with a friend, sure.  I shake hands with the guy and a minute later he's bleeding all over my socks.

Speaker: attorney
Dialogue: Will that do officers?  My client has had a terrible shock.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Yeah, he's not used to seeing other people do the killing.

Speaker: abolofia
Dialogue: Hard to believe a trained police officer could let this kind of thing happen right in front of his face.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I did make a mistake.  I let the wrong guy get hit.

Speaker: abolofia
Dialogue: Cheer up, Nick.  I'm sure it's easier to pick a dead man's pocket.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: Doesn't speak a word of English. And he won't speak Japanese either. No papers.  The Japanese embassy is very interested.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: He's wanted in Japan.  They want him first.  Then we can have him.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: Japanese embassy talks to state department.  State talks to police plaza.  They to me and me to you. Shit rolls down hill.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: You and Charlie are taking the Jap home, tonight.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What...?  What if I say no?

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: Check your gun before you leave. They're not allowed in Japan.  It's a nice, safe country.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: They said send a detective if I could spare one.  I can always spare you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You got something to say to me, Captain?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: ... Nick, you're the one that's always saying you never go anywhere.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I was thinking the Poconos, Charlie. Maybe Vegas.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: What are you missing?  Riding your motorcycle to the nurse's house. That shit is sadder than Ethiopia.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Beats forty hours on a plane.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: They say we got to turn around and come right back.  That's what they say.  I got a plan.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I call, right?  I say I got the dreaded thirty six-hour Asian shits from some raw clam and we stretch it into three days.  You and I become a driving force on the local Geisha scene.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hey, come on, big guy like you, cop from New York.  You're gonna be the biggest thing to hit town since Godzilla.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Says here, it's very impolite to touch someone while you're talking to them...  Guess that means you can't talk and screw at the same time, huh, hotdog? What's the matter, no -- speaky-the- language?  Understand this:  You will never ever fuck with my partner again.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Where is the subway station, please.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Nick, have I been a good partner?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I just want you to know... I mean anybody who says you ever took has got to deal with me.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: You didn't take, did you...?  You hear things.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I worked the three nine in Queens, Charlie.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The lieutenant was on the pad along with the rest of the squad.  I was new, didn't know shit.  When the feathers flew, I got called in front of the special prosecutor.  It's on the top of my personnel file.  They think I'm dirty or I cut a deal. Doesn't leave you with a lot of friends either way.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I might as well have done something. I've been paying for it every goddamn day since I got transferred...

Speaker: nagashima
Dialogue: Officers Conklin and -- and...  ... gentlemen, welcome.  I am assistant inspector Nagashima.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You going to take this crap off our hands?

Speaker: nagashima
Dialogue: If you will please give this to the customs inspector he will expidate -- expedite you.  We have a car and a driver outside.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Givin' you a book is like givin' a baby a gun.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Inspector Nagashima told me to give you this.

Speaker: inspector
Dialogue: You must get in line behind the rest.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What's going on?  We're the good guys!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Get me something like an Identi-Kit and I'll give you a description.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: There must be some witnesses from the airport?

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: You lost a man we wanted for some time.  It was very incompetent on your part, officer.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Incompetent is letting people waltz through a secure area wearing your uniforms, carrying official documents.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Work with me.  I want your best detective.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey, inspector, I don't intend to take the rap for this.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Do you know what this is?

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: It's a laundry list.  Go home, detective.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: ... Detective Ich-iro Matsu-moto. Hey, we're getting Mr. Moto on our side.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Food... Food, here we go.  Tokyo offers a wide variety of food.  It's best to sample the local specialties, including sashaimi, soba, and world renown Kobe beef...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You said that in the last two places.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'd feel better if we had some heat.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Think we could find our way back?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Detective Ichiro Matsumoto.  I'm the man you're looking for.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: The man you are looking for, Kobo, was a member of the Samaguchi-gummi. A Yakuza.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Where do we start looking for this guy?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Where would you look for the mafia?

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: The back room at Lombardi's after the Columbus Day Parade.  Under the bed.  In the mayor's office. Everywhere.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: To the killer.  Jerry Lee Lewis.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Jerry Lee Lewis, Elvis, Dinky Doo And The Don't's.  Let's book, Charlie.  If he starts on Motown, we'll be here all night.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: No, this is the place for the young Yakuza.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: That's what you said in the last three piss pots.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I love you people.  The music, the clothes, the movies... Japanese respect only what is Japanese.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's incredible.  Hit him or something.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: I don't think he'd feel it.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Americans change everything.  When I was young the city was wood and paper... I was ten when the bombers came.  I lived underground for three days.  When I came up, the city was gone... A ball of fire.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: It began to rain, Nick.  You know what color the rain was?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Black... It was black from the ash. Very impressive.  You Americans, you could make black rain.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Say Ich, between friends, where can I grab some squish around here?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Ah, Joyce...  How are you tonight?

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: He gets as much as he wants.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Hello hello, Charlie Skloaris.  New York City.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: My partner and I are cops.  When do you get off?

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Right when you're being tucked into bed.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You should be nicer to my American friends, Joyce.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: They wouldn't appreciate it, Ich. Trust me.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: ... We got to keep looking.  Track him down!  Great balls of fire!

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: ... He's a sorry old guy, but I like him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: He couldn't find his ass with both hands.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Now that's the kind of motorcycle I want to see you on.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sure, a rice burning crotch rocket...

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: Nick, how we gonna bag this guy without any help?  Maybe I should work on that girl Joyce, she speaks the language.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Leave the rice cake outside and go home!

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: There's been a murder.  Yakuza.  You should come.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Why don't you ask your chief detective?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Because I want you to tell me.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: The young are eating the old, something that usually doesn't happen here.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Can we skip the poetry, inspector?

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: There's a war, detective, between two rival groups.  The man who escaped, Kobo, leads the younger group.  They did this.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Kobo's a wild boy.  He was a lieutenant in the Sammaguchi-gummi.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Excellent, Officer Matsumoto.  How is your investigation going?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Well, sir.  Thank you for giving me the opportunity to work with these distinguished gentlemen.

Speaker: police lieutenant
Dialogue: Looking for clues in the bottom of a sake bottle, Matsumoto?

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: He's an officer of great distinction.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Have you changed your mind and decided to go home, detective?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Not until one of us bags Kobo.  And it doesn't look like you're doing so hot.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You know, Inspector, you take shit once, you take shit forever.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I planned on catching him, Captain.

Speaker: radio
Dialogue: ... That was the Bird, from the Blue Note years.  1230 hours and 72 degrees in central Osaka.  This is specialist Doug Dale, Tapestries in Jazz, on the Far East Network, armed forces radio...

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: They made you leave your hotel...  ... you caused a disturbance.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: It may be too soon to talk about it. When someone we care for dies we...  ... keep something of their's.  A tie, a pen.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Why weren't you at the platform?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I couldn't keep up.  My shame is complete.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I'll get him for you, Nick.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I want to cash it in.  Yen.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: There was a change in plans.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: An outside person.  A foreigner.  A barbarian.  You, me.  More you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I could use some help.  Show me around.  I'll pay you for your time.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You can count on the truth from people who don't like you.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: You have a helluva way of asking for help.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You have a helluva way of answering.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Look, you need Ich.  I've been here five years and I still can't read all the street signs.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I've continued working on the case!

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Kobo has disappeared.  My superiors don't trust me.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Kobo's.  Taken off him when he was arrested in New York.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I knew you'd come back.  You feel you have a debt you can never pay. But you will, even if it costs you your life.  Giri.  Honor.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: We can ask someone I used to work with.  A criminal.  Someone I pay money to...

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: He says they're very nice.  He wants to know if you have anymore.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: This man must be treated with respect.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Nick, no one's seen Kobo in three days.  He might not even be in Tokyo.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Only one way to find out... Get her up in the morning and put her to bed at night.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Think you could keep it to a dull roar?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You said you could keep up with her! 'No problem, Nick-san.'

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: No.  Don't say anything.  Don't do anything, and for Christ's sake, don't apologize!

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I'm a joke.  They sent you to me to make a fool of you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You're doing fine, Ich.  Now drop it, okay?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: If you're gonna give me a hard time, wait outside.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Not too shabby for a perfume pusher.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Too bad it's not in yen.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Four goddamn days.  This is going nowhere...

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: She ever pull down her shades?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sure, but then I just pull out the photos.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Broiled fish paste cake, Kelp roll, soybean curd, devils tongue --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Smells like Bayonne at low tide.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Don't say anything more.  Don't do anything.  And, for Christ's sake, don't apologize!

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You can't come in.  They don't want --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: If I smell one drop of Scotch on your breath, my friend --

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I have to piss, gentlemen... I'm so sorry but I have to --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: We're through.  I mean it.  This is the end of the line, Matsumoto.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You shut-up!  Kobo is inside.  He's with Sugai, the head of the Summaguchi-clan.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: ... A Godfather.  His man was killed at the printing plant.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Not without a small army, Nicklaus- san.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Ich, my name is Nick.  Not Nicklaus, not Nicklaus-san, not Nick-san. Nick.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: ... But you can take care of yourself.  You're 'the biggest thing to hit this town since Godzilla.'

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: What's the matter.  I'm right in front of you, Nick.  But I was right in front of you when you let Charlie die.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: Walk away again.  Maybe you'll get used to it.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: A few minutes faster, we might've nailed him.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Your visa has expired.  Be on a plane in twenty-four hours or you will be deported.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: While you were hanging out at the visa office, we found the son-of-a- bitch.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: You ruined an on-going investigation that could have gotten us more than one runner.  I want a full report in the morning, officer.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Maybe if you'd work with us --

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: HEY, I'M TALKING TO YOU, INSPECTOR!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Damnit, Ichiro, I'm tired of people telling me what I can and can't do. No one ever solved anything sitting on their ass.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I want to go talk to him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Because he knows how to get to our man.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: He'll never speak to a Gaiijin.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The little bastard.  God bless him.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's a new deal.  ... coming with me tomorrow?

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Sugai's not going to be impressed with your gun, Nick.  No.  I won't put myself in danger for you anymore.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sure, pal.  You've got better things to do.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You know where I can get a decent cup of coffee this time of night? I'm buying.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Somebody must be suffering somewhere, you're being so nice.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: I've heard of Sugai.  I've also heard of the emperor.  They're both national treasures.  One's a hood.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I need someone to translate for me.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: My Japanese isn't that hot... Besides, you'll never get in.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's my last shot.  I have to be on a plane home tomorrow night.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: You're wrong to sell Ich short.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: His son hooked up with some bikers. Yakuza kids.  A cop shot him running from a robbery.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: A father doesn't out live that kind of thing here, much less a police officer...

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: The woman in the apartment.  She won't speak to him.  But she won't leave either.  Japan... Nice, huh?

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: I'd invite you up but I know you'd hate the incense.  I chant.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: 'Nam oyo ranged kyo.'  You think it's dumb of course.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Not if it works.  I'll meet you at the train?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I don't remember you saying no.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Who am I supposed to be?

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: This little guy thinks you're Robert Redford... the other one thinks you're Charles Bronson...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Ichiro.  I lost it last night.  I shouldn't have hit you.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: For Sugai.  Caviar, French cheese, ham... If you come to apologize for interrupting his meeting, Sugai may feel obligated to see you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Hey, Ich... Thanks.  I'm glad you're here.  I mean it.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: They took the gift an hour ago.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: All's not lost.  There's a famous temple here.  We could chant.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Pick it up.  Look at it.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Seven years work by the finest engraver.  Mass produced, sequentially numbered.  The best there has ever been, Mr. Conklin.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I'm impressed.  But let's use the short form.  I'm looking for --

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: -- Kobo... I know.  He killed two of my partners.  One in New York, one at the printing plant.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: I took Kobo from the street.  I gave him a home, a future... But my ways were too slow for him... I served seven years in prison for my boss when I was a young man.  Kobo wouldn't serve seven minutes for his Oyabun.  He was supposed to take over this syndicate when I retired.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Our associates in New York were close to closing a deal with us.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The families who control the casinos?

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Yes.  Unlike our syndicates, your criminals don't understand the words 'honor' and 'duty'... We can't afford not to deal with them.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Imagine if your families could pay their gambling and drug debts with perfect counterfeit bought for cents on the dollar.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: The Feds would be onto you in a month.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Not with these bills.  And even if it only took them six months, do you know what our profit margin would be?

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: The other plate is currently in New York, in the hands of Kobo's man. Find it for me.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Swiss bank deposit.  Gold bullion. Whatever you want.  You know the city and the police.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: You're smarter than Kobo.  You know the price of deceit.  Think about it.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I have ten hours to grab my man.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It's done.  You don't have to come.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Explain to them.  They shoot me, they kill you.  DO IT!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Grab the keys, Ich, and get inside.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Not now, man, okay, not now.  Work with me.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You don't know what you're doing.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: You came up with the first part.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Kobo will meet me here tomorrow. Ten a.m.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: He'll find out you took me.  I'm unprotected.  He'll kill us.  All of us.  You don't stand a chance.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: You're out of your mind.  I'm leaving.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Bullshit, Nick.  And don't tell me this is all just about Charlie. It's not.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: I still think you're a bastard.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Wouldn't help.  Watch out for Ich.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Contact your associate in New York and tell him to hand my plate over to Abolofia.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: You have betrayed the syndicate and personally dishonored me.  I would rather the deal fell through than...

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: Abolofia's person has received the plate.  It's done.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: I wanted you to see him like this.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: After a court convicts him.  He belongs to me.

Speaker: sugai
Dialogue: If anything happens to Abolofia or my plate, detective...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: It took 12 years to make it, you could take five minutes to drink it.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I called Ohashi, he'll be waiting.  I like him waiting.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: Ugly... A couple of thousand years they've been bound by these little rules.  Looking in.  Always afraid. Ugly little lives...

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Save it, I already took the tour.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: You are a lucky man.  Where you come from a man can stand out.  It's expected.  Here a man is made to look a fool for standing out.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: I like your friend, Joyce.  You're lucky.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: She's such a long way home for you.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: I want the plate from your pal, Sugai.  When you get it, you get her.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sugai won't give it to me, you know that.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing?!

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Your plane leaves at six.  Two officers will escort you.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: For God's sake, Ohashi, I need your help.  Let me out of here!

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: If anything happens to her while I'm here --

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: -- Do you know where she is, detective?  Do you know how to find her?  Even where to start?  We will find them.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I have to get to Sugai.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: I was ready to have your ass for taking off on me.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: I followed them.  An hour from the train station.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: We need the plate to negotiate with.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: You know, Ichiro, you just burned your bridges.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Now we've got nothing to negotiate with.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Joyce told me about your family. It's tough...

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You know, Nick, we can't lose.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Because we're the biggest things to hit this town since Godzilla.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: There's nothing you can do for me anymore.  I have the plate.  Sugai's dead.  No there is something.

Speaker: kobo
Dialogue: You can tell me who I should shoot first.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: Constable Ichiro Matsumoto presents captured prisoner Kobo, Chief Inspector Ohashi.

Speaker: ohashi
Dialogue: Inspector Ohashi will take charge of the prisoner.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Can't make you change your mind?

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Last time you asked me to come along I nearly got a hole in my head.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Might be different in New York.

Speaker: joyce
Dialogue: Maybe.  If I come visit, we can find out.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Joyce, give the assistant Chief Inspector a drink, would you?

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: ... Remember, counterfeiting is the Feds.  They'll be all over Abolofia's place.  Stick tight. You I.D. the other plate, he does real time.

Speaker: oliver
Dialogue: You know, Nick, if you'd held on to that plate, you could've been a very rich man.

Speaker: sergeant
Dialogue: Saddle up.  Hard team in the first unit.  Conklin, your RMP awaits.

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Sure you want to come?  Probably better than the Greyline Tour.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: You wouldn't make it without me.

Speaker: ich
Dialogue: How can you be so sure?

Speaker: nick
Dialogue: Cause you're the biggest thing to hit this town since...
